required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Different Dialysis Strategies on Inflammation in COVID-19 Maintenance Hemodialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Inflammatory Cytokine Profile in Maintenance Hemodialysis Patients Affected by COVID-19: Effects of 2 Different Dialysis Strategies

collaborator.agency: IRCCS Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria San Martino - IST Istituto Nazionale per la Ricerca sul Cancro, Genoa, Italy

brief_summary.textblock:
In the course of Coronavirus Disease-19 (COVID-19) uncontrolled inflammation has been related to disease severity and unfavorable outcomes.
Here, the investigators study the longitudinal changes of pro- and anti-inflammatory markers in a population of patients undergoing maintenance hemodialysis (HD) affected by COVID-19, evaluating the potential modulating effects of two different dialysis approaches

detailed_description.textblock:
For this prospective randomized study, the investigators recruit maintenance hemodialysis patients with confirmed COVID-19 infection. After diagnosis, the patients are randomized to two different dialysis modalities, expanded HD (HDx), performed by use of a medium cut-off membrane, and standard treatment based on the use of a protein-leaking dialyzer (PLD).
The investigators collect clinical and laboratory data, including circulating pre and post-dialysis levels of interleukin-6 (IL-6), interleukin-8 (IL-8), interleukin-10 (IL-10), soluble TLR4 (sTLR4), and interferon-gamma (IFN-g). Samples are collected at diagnosis (T0), and one and two weeks after the diagnosis (T7 and T14, respectively). Moreover, lymphocyte and immune cell profiles are evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal changes of interleukin-6 (IL-6), interleukin-8 (IL-8), interleukin-10 (IL-10), and interferon-gamma (IFN-Î³) plasma levels during Covid19 in hemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Two-week observation period after Covid19 diagnosis
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of circulating levels of pro and anti-inflammatory cytokines (pg/ml) at different time-points in patients treated with two different dialysis modalities

primary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal changes of soluble TLR4 (sTLR4) plasma levels during Covid19 in hemodialysis patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Two-week observation period after Covid19 diagnosis
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of circulating levels of soluble TLR4 (sTLR4, ng/ml)at different time-points in patients treated with two different dialysis modalities

secondary_outcome.measure: Longitudinal changes of cluster of differentiation 4 (CD4), cluster of differentiation 8 (CD8), cluster of differentiation 19 (CD19), natural killer (NK) lymphocyte count and function during Covid19 in hemodialysis patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two-week observation period after Covid19 diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Lymphocyte and immune cell profiles studied by flow cytometry

arm_group.description: Hemodialysis modality performed by using a medium cut-off membrane
Hemodialysis modality performed by using a membrane with accentuated absorption capacities.

intervention.intervention_name: Expanded Hemodialysis for Covid19 maintenance hemodialysis patients
intervention.description: After Covid19 diagnosis participants are randomized to receive Expanded Hemodialysis for two weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Hemodialysis by protein-leaking dialyzer for Covid19 maintenance hemodialysis patients
intervention.description: After Covid19 diagnosis participants are randomized to receive hemodialysis by protein-leaking dialyzer for two weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing maintenance hemodialysis
- Confirmed severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus2 infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute kidney injury

overall_official.affiliation: Unit of Nephrology, Dept Internal Medicine, Univerity of Genova and San Martino Hospital

reference.citation: Esposito P, Russo R, Conti N, Falqui V, Massarino F, Moriero E, Peloso G, Traverso GB, Garibotto G, Viazzi F. Management of COVID-19 in hemodialysis patients: The Genoa experience. Hemodial Int. 2020 Jul;24(3):423-427. doi: 10.1111/hdi.12837. Epub 2020 May 12.

Kidney disease and all-cause mortality in patients with COVID-19 hospitalized in Genoa, Northern Italy. J Nephrol. 2020 Oct 6. doi: 10.1007/s40620-020-00875-1. [Epub ahead of print]
